Comment 1: 
MakeSlice takes as its argument the type to make, just like the make builtin does.

Also, you might want to call MakeSlice on something with a named type.
For example, you might MakeSlice a vector.StringVector.  It wouldn't help
in that case to pass plain string.

From an implementation standpoint, reflect does not have the ability
to make new types out of thin air.  Given T it has no way to construct []T.
